eligibility:
•  Enable students to engage with key literary and cultural theories, particularly those relevant to South Asian contexts. •  Equip students with skills applicable to publishing, journalism, cultural policy, digital media, and creative industries. •  Train students in advanced research methods and critical thinking to contribute meaningfully to academic and professional discourses. •  Offer hands-on experience with industry partners, internships, and project-based learning. •  Instill a sense of social responsibility and critical engagement with cultural and political issues in South Asia.
PO1: Apply advanced literary and cultural theories to analyze texts and cultural phenomena with a South Asian focus PO2: Design and execute rigorous, interdisciplinary research projects that contribute to contemporary academic and professional debates PO3:Utilize cultural and literary expertise in fields such as publishing, media, public relations, journalism, and cultural policy PO4:Navigate and critique global cultural trends while maintaining a nuanced understanding of South Asian socio-political realities PO5:Engage critically with issues of gender, caste, class, race, and technology to promote diversity and inclusivity in cultural discourses
PSO1: Graduates will apply advanced literary and cultural theories to critically analyze texts and cultural phenomena, with a specialized focus on South Asian contexts, demonstrating an in-depth understanding of regional and global cultural intersections. PSO2: Graduates will design and execute rigorous, interdisciplinary research projects that contribute to contemporary academic and professional debates, integrating insights from literature, media, linguistics, and cultural studies to address pressing social and intellectual concerns. PSO3: Graduates will utilize their expertise in literature and culture across diverse professional fields such as publishing, media, journalism, public relations, and cultural policy, while critically engaging with global and South Asian socio-political trends to foster inclusivity and ethical discourse.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Relevant and Contemporary Curriculum Innovative Pedagogy Innovative Assessment Practices Research Internships Service Learning

To discuss / debate / think and ideate on topics in depth To be able to present arguments on current debates and emerging concerns confidently To conduct Research that informs, educates and expands the intellect To present oneself professionally while submitting assignments and while making presentations To give back to society by engaging in Service learning projects To be able to identify the need, plan, organize and manage events that require attention and debate
